summary:
My vision is, change is progress! With my enthusiastic approach and perseverance I lead people into change towards a new way of working which is related to the goals of the organization. I am a behavioral expert and master Organizational Behavior Management, which leads organizations towards desired results. Because of my open character I can easily level with different types of people.
People management is important to reach results. By coaching people I believe you can strengthen your organisation to work towards a better performance. Taking care of your employees is a source for success. People need clear expectations and leadership to guide them in their work. Different leadership styles are important to help employees to find their way in reaching the results. I coach and lead in organizational change.

profile_positions.description: Advies en begeleiding bij cultuur en gedragsverandertrajecten en HSE gerelateerde vraagstukken op beleidsniveau.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director | Founder

profile_positions.description:
As part of the Supply Chain Management team I am responsible for SHE policy-and improvement within Dairy Essentials which contains 12 factories. I lead a team of SHE specialists who deliver support to the factories on complex SHE problems. From this team of specialists we run Business Group wide improvement programs on safety culture, chemicals, machine safety, etc. We coach SHE Managers in setting up their SHE yearplan and challenge site management teams on SHE plan progress. Working with a clear mission and vision is important to lead the Business Group into the right direction towards a world class performance in Safety, Health and Environment. As an internal coach and consultant I support the factories in this journey.
Behavioral & cultural change is my expertise. I developed several leadership trainings. As an internal trainer of behavioral change (OBM) I provide leadership teams with guidance and support. Developed a safety culture scan and conducted this scan in several factories to determine the safety culture status and provided support and guidance in reaching the next level in safety culture.
profile_positions.title: Business Group Safety, Health and Environment Manager

profile_positions.description:
As a Safety, Health and Environment Manager I am responsible for the SHE policy of the Heineken Zoeterwoude brewery. In my current role I have a team of 3 specialists and app 7 external projectleaders. 
My main focus is to manage the SHE agenda of the brewery and to manage the safety agenda voor Heineken Netherlands Supply.  Helping and coaching my team and managers in the brewery is what I like most. 
Focus on cultural change is very important to reach the goal of safe working and the result of zero accidents. I believe that focus on behavior and explaining the 'Why' is the key-factor to success and will not only influence safety performance but also other processes. Cultural change is my expertise and I have developed a program for Heineken Zoeterwoude to influence the culture with a bottom up approach.
profile_positions.title: Manager SHE Heineken Zoeterwoude & Safety responsible for Heineken Netherlands Supply

profile_positions.description:
As a SHE Project manager, I advice the Brewery Manager of Zoeterwoude how to increase the safety performance. I coordinate and execute projects for Safety, Health and Environmental issues. An important responsibility in my job is a change management program to increase the safety culture of the Heineken Zoeterwoude brewery. In this program I lead, in collaboration with a team, the development of management training programs and coach managers to learn more about safety and their responsibility in safety. Cases based on practical situations are used in this program to keep it simple and accessible to apply. Accident investigation, doing risk analysis and analysing safety data are also responsibilities in my job. In preparation of the ‘Safety day’ 2010, 2011, 2012 and 2013 I played a coordinating and executing role in the organizational workgroup. My main goal is to support the brewery management to a top class safety performance, in reaching zero accidents.

The implementation of the environmental pillar and a sustainability program, which is based on the Brewing a Better World program, to increase the environmental performances of the brewery Zoeterwoude is also a key focus in my job. In collaboration with the province of ‘Zuid Holland’ and the University of Wageningen I coordinate and participate in a diversity of projects to improve the (internal and external) environment of the brewery.

As a TPM Facilitator I support the Safety pillar to roll-out the TPM methodology and training the Safety pillar members in their role. Advising and coaching the Brewery Manager, department managers and safety pillar members to prioritize on TPM subjects and safety issues. I facilitate safety improvement teams within the brewery and train the team members on TPM procedures and in using TPM tools. Also tasks as auditing and leading safety and competence gap reduction teams are part of my job.
profile_positions.title: TPM Facilitator/SHE Project Manager

profile_positions.description: Main tasks were supporting two Department Managers in preparing presentations, organizing and facilitating workshops and meetings. Extra tasks in the function as a management assistant were organizing a worldwide Innovation Contest, being member of a team for organizing the INEX a worldwide presentation fair to present all running projects for Heineken employees only, communication with leading customers and/ or work relations of the department. Safety administrator of the Research and Development department is an additional task which I have introduced and developed in this department.
profile_positions.title: Management Assistent

profile_positions.description: As a Project Manager my daily job activities were implementing inbound and outbound helpdesks and service lines for different products and services in close contact with the client.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager
